fields.name: size
fields.description: The size of the current page

values.name: APP_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Unspecified Envelope Type.

values.name: APP_TYPE_AGENT_A2A
values.description: Agent A2A App Type.

values.name: APP_TYPE_AGENT_OASF
values.description: Agent OASF App Type.

values.name: APP_TYPE_AGENT_MCP_SERVER
values.description: Agent MCP Server App Type.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for the App.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: name
fields.description: A human-readable name for the App.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description for the App.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: value
fields.description: The count of apps of the given type

fields.name: counts
fields.description: The apps count per app type
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: page
fields.description: The current page of the pagination
fields.label: optional

fields.name: size
fields.description: The page size of the pagination
fields.label: optional

enums.name: BadgeType
enums.description:
The content of the Credential.
Multiple content types can be supported: AgentBadge, etc.

values.name: CREDENTIAL_CONTENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Unspecified Content Type.

values.name: CREDENTIAL_CONTENT_TYPE_AGENT_BADGE
values.description:
AgentBadge Content Type.
The Agent content representation following a defined schema
OASF: https://schema.oasf.agntcy.org/schema/objects/agent
Google A2A: https://github.com/google/A2A/blob/main/specification/json/a2a.json

values.name: CREDENTIAL_CONTENT_TYPE_MCP_BADGE
values.description:
McpBadge Content Type.
The MCP content representation following a defined schema
The schema is defined in the MCP specification as the MCPServer type

messages.name: BadgeClaims
messages.description:
BadgeClaims represents the content of a Badge VC defined [here]

[here]: https://spec.identity.agntcy.org/docs/vc/intro/

messages.name: CredentialSchema
messages.description:
CredentialSchema represents the credentialSchema property of a Verifiable Credential.
more information can be found [here]

[here]: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model-2.0/#data-schemas

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type specifies the type of the file
fields.label: optional

fields.name: id
fields.description: The URL identifying the schema file
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Proof
messages.description:
A data integrity proof provides information about the proof mechanism,
parameters required to verify that proof, and the proof value itself.

messages.name: VerifiableCredential
messages.description:
DataModel represents the W3C Verifiable Credential Data Model defined [here]

[here]: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/

enums.name: ErrorReason
enums.description:
Represents the reason for an error, providing a unique
constant value for the error.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_UNSPECIFIED
values.description:
ERROR_REASON_UNSPECIFIED indicates that no specific error reason
has been specified.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_INTERNAL
values.description: An internal error, this happens in case of unexpected condition or failure within the service

values.name: ERROR_REASON_INVALID_CREDENTIAL_ENVELOPE_TYPE
values.description:
The credential envelope type is invalid. For valid values refer to
the enum CredentialEnvelopeType.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_INVALID_CREDENTIAL_ENVELOPE_VALUE_FORMAT
values.description:
The credential envelope value format does not correspond to the format
specified in envelope_type.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_INVALID_ISSUER
values.description: The issuer contains one or more invalid fields.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_ISSUER_NOT_REGISTERED
values.description: The issuer is not registered in the Node.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_INVALID_VERIFIABLE_CREDENTIAL
values.description:
The Verifiable Credential is invalid, this can be related to either
invalid format or unable to verify the Data Integrity proof.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_IDP_REQUIRED
values.description: The Identity Provider (IdP) is required for the operation, but it is not provided.

values.name: ERROR_REASON_INVALID_PROOF
values.description: The proof is invalid

values.name: ERROR_REASON_UNSUPPORTED_PROOF
values.description: The proof type is not supported

values.name: ERROR_REASON_RESOLVER_METADATA_NOT_FOUND
values.description: Unable to resolve an ID to a ResolverMetadata

values.name: ERROR_REASON_UNKNOWN_IDP
values.description: Unknown Identity Provider

values.name: ERROR_REASON_ID_ALREADY_REGISTERED
values.description: The ID and Resolver Metadata are already registered in the system

messages.name: ErrorInfo
messages.description: Describes the cause of the error with structured details.

fields.name: reason
fields.description:
The reason of the error, as defined by the ErrorReason enum.
This is a constant unique value that helps identify the cause of
the error.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: message
fields.description:
The message describing the error in a human-readable way. This
field gives additional details about the error.
fields.label: optional

values.name: IDP_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Unspecified Envelope Type.

values.name: IDP_TYPE_DUO
values.description: Idp Type Duo.

values.name: IDP_TYPE_OKTA
values.description: Idp Type Okta.

values.name: IDP_TYPE_SELF
values.description: Idp Type Self.

fields.name: issuer_id
fields.description:
A unique identifier for the Issuer.
This is typically the Issuer's ID in the Identity.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: key_id
fields.description:
A unique identifier for the Key.
This is typically the Key's ID in the vault provider.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: duo_idp_settings
fields.description: Settings for the Duo Identity Provider.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: okta_idp_settings
fields.description: Settings for the Okta Identity Provider.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: api_key
fields.description: An API Key for the Identity Platform.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: SetApiKeyRequest
messages.description: Empty request for setting up API Key.

fields.name: issuer_settings
fields.description: The Issuer Settings to set up.

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
